weaknesses.description: The product deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently ensuring that the resulting data will be valid.

weaknesses.name: Embedded Malicious Code
weaknesses.description: The product contains code that appears to be malicious in nature.

weaknesses.name: Trojan Horse
weaknesses.description: The product appears to contain benign or useful functionality, but it also contains code that is hidden from normal operation that violates the intended security policy of the user or the system administrator.

weaknesses.name: Non-Replicating Malicious Code
weaknesses.description: Non-replicating malicious code only resides on the target system or product that is attacked; it does not attempt to spread to other systems.

weaknesses.name: Replicating Malicious Code (Virus or Worm)
weaknesses.description: Replicating malicious code, including viruses and worms, will attempt to attack other systems once it has successfully compromised the target system or the product.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: '/multiple//internal/slash'
weaknesses.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple internal slash ('/multiple//internal/slash/') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

weaknesses.name: Trapdoor
weaknesses.description: A trapdoor is a hidden piece of code that responds to a special input, allowing its user access to resources without passing through the normal security enforcement mechanism.

weaknesses.name: Logic/Time Bomb
weaknesses.description: The product contains code that is designed to disrupt the legitimate operation of the product (or its environment) when a certain time passes, or when a certain logical condition is met.

weaknesses.name: Spyware
weaknesses.description: The product collects personally identifiable information about a human user or the user's activities, but the product accesses this information using other resources besides itself, and it does not require that user's explicit approval or direct input into the product.

weaknesses.name: Covert Channel
weaknesses.description: A covert channel is a path that can be used to transfer information in a way not intended by the system's designers.

weaknesses.name: Covert Storage Channel
weaknesses.description: A covert storage channel transfers information through the setting of bits by one program and the reading of those bits by another. What distinguishes this case from that of ordinary operation is that the bits are used to convey encoded information.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Covert Timing Channel
weaknesses.description: This weakness can be found at CWE-385.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: '/multiple/trailing/slash//'
weaknesses.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple trailing slash ('/multiple/trailing/slash//') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

weaknesses.name: .NET Misconfiguration: Use of Impersonation
weaknesses.description: Allowing a .NET application to run at potentially escalated levels of access to the underlying operating and file systems can be dangerous and result in various forms of attacks.

weaknesses.name: Weak Password Requirements
weaknesses.description: The product does not require that users should have strong passwords, which makes it easier for attackers to compromise user accounts.

weaknesses.name: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
weaknesses.description: The product transmits or stores authentication credentials, but it uses an insecure method that is susceptible to unauthorized interception and/or retrieval.

weaknesses.name: Unprotected Transport of Credentials
weaknesses.description: Login pages do not use adequate measures to protect the user name and password while they are in transit from the client to the server.

weaknesses.name: Use of Cache Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: The code uses a cache that contains sensitive information, but the cache can be read by an actor outside of the intended control sphere.

weaknesses.name: Use of Web Browser Cache Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: The web application does not use an appropriate caching policy that specifies the extent to which each web page and associated form fields should be cached.

weaknesses.name: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information in an Environment Variable
weaknesses.description: The product uses an environment variable to store unencrypted sensitive information.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Version-Control Repository to an Unauthorized Control Sphere
weaknesses.description: The product stores a CVS, git, or other repository in a directory, archive, or other resource that is stored, transferred, or otherwise made accessible to unauthorized actors.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Core Dump File to an Unauthorized Control Sphere
weaknesses.description: The product generates a core dump file in a directory, archive, or other resource that is stored, transferred, or otherwise made accessible to unauthorized actors.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Access Control List Files to an Unauthorized Control Sphere
weaknesses.description: The product stores access control list files in a directory or other container that is accessible to actors outside of the intended control sphere.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: '\multiple\\internal\backslash'
weaknesses.description: The product accepts path input in the form of multiple internal backslash ('\multiple\trailing\\slash') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Backup File to an Unauthorized Control Sphere
weaknesses.description: A backup file is stored in a directory or archive that is made accessible to unauthorized actors.

weaknesses.name: Inclusion of Sensitive Information in Test Code
weaknesses.description: Accessible test applications can pose a variety of security risks. Since developers or administrators rarely consider that someone besides themselves would even know about the existence of these applications, it is common for them to contain sensitive information or functions.

weaknesses.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
weaknesses.description: The product writes sensitive information to a log file.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Information Exposure Through Server Log Files
weaknesses.description: This entry has been deprecated because its abstraction was too low-level. See CWE-532.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Information Exposure Through Debug Log Files
weaknesses.description: This entry has been deprecated because its abstraction was too low-level. See CWE-532.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Information Through Shell Error Message
weaknesses.description: A command shell error message indicates that there exists an unhandled exception in the web application code. In many cases, an attacker can leverage the conditions that cause these errors in order to gain unauthorized access to the system.

weaknesses.name: Servlet Runtime Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: A servlet error message indicates that there exists an unhandled exception in your web application code and may provide useful information to an attacker.

weaknesses.name: Java Runtime Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: In many cases, an attacker can leverage the conditions that cause unhandled exception errors in order to gain unauthorized access to the system.

weaknesses.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Externally-Accessible File or Directory
weaknesses.description: The product places sensitive information into files or directories that are accessible to actors who are allowed to have access to the files, but not to the sensitive information.

weaknesses.name: Use of Persistent Cookies Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: The web application uses persistent cookies, but the cookies contain sensitive information.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: 'filedir\' (Trailing Backslash)
weaknesses.description: The product accepts path input in the form of trailing backslash ('filedir\') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

weaknesses.name: Inclusion of Sensitive Information in Source Code
weaknesses.description: Source code on a web server or repository often contains sensitive information and should generally not be accessible to users.

weaknesses.name: Inclusion of Sensitive Information in an Include File
weaknesses.description: If an include file source is accessible, the file can contain usernames and passwords, as well as sensitive information pertaining to the application and system.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Information Exposure Through Cleanup Log Files
weaknesses.description: This entry has been deprecated because its abstraction was too low-level. See CWE-532.

weaknesses.name: Use of Singleton Pattern Without Synchronization in a Multithreaded Context
weaknesses.description: The product uses the singleton pattern when creating a resource within a multithreaded environment.

weaknesses.name: Missing Standardized Error Handling Mechanism
weaknesses.description: The product does not use a standardized method for handling errors throughout the code, which might introduce inconsistent error handling and resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Use of Dynamic Class Loading
weaknesses.description: This weakness has been deprecated because it partially overlaps CWE-470, it describes legitimate programmer behavior, and other portions will need to be integrated into other entries.

weaknesses.name: Suspicious Comment
weaknesses.description: The code contains comments that suggest the presence of bugs, incomplete functionality, or weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Use of Hard-coded, Security-relevant Constants
weaknesses.description: The product uses hard-coded constants instead of symbolic names for security-critical values, which increases the likelihood of mistakes during code maintenance or security policy change.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Information Through Directory Listing
weaknesses.description: The product inappropriately exposes a directory listing with an index of all the resources located inside of the directory.

weaknesses.name: Missing Password Field Masking
weaknesses.description: The product does not mask passwords during entry, increasing the potential for attackers to observe and capture passwords.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: '/./' (Single Dot Directory)
weaknesses.description: The product accepts path input in the form of single dot directory exploit ('/./') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

weaknesses.name: Server-generated Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: Certain conditions, such as network failure, will cause a server error message to be displayed.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Authorization Before Parsing and Canonicalization
weaknesses.description: If a web server does not fully parse requested URLs before it examines them for authorization, it may be possible for an attacker to bypass authorization protection.

weaknesses.name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
weaknesses.description: The product makes files or directories accessible to unauthorized actors, even though they should not be.

weaknesses.name: Command Shell in Externally Accessible Directory
weaknesses.description: A possible shell file exists in /cgi-bin/ or other accessible directories. This is extremely dangerous and can be used by an attacker to execute commands on the web server.

weaknesses.name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Not Using Input Validation Framework
weaknesses.description: The ASP.NET application does not use an input validation framework.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Plaintext Password in Configuration File
weaknesses.description: The J2EE application stores a plaintext password in a configuration file.

weaknesses.name: ASP.NET Misconfiguration: Use of Identity Impersonation
weaknesses.description: Configuring an ASP.NET application to run with impersonated credentials may give the application unnecessary privileges.

weaknesses.name: Use of getlogin() in Multithreaded Application
weaknesses.description: The product uses the getlogin() function in a multithreaded context, potentially causing it to return incorrect values.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: 'filedir*' (Wildcard)
weaknesses.description: The product accepts path input in the form of asterisk wildcard ('filedir*') without appropriate validation, which can lead to ambiguous path resolution and allow an attacker to traverse the file system to unintended locations or access arbitrary files.

weaknesses.name: Use of umask() with chmod-style Argument
weaknesses.description: The product calls umask() with an incorrect argument that is specified as if it is an argument to chmod().

weaknesses.name: Dead Code
weaknesses.description: The product contains dead code, which can never be executed.

weaknesses.name: Return of Stack Variable Address
weaknesses.description: A function returns the address of a stack variable, which will cause unintended program behavior, typically in the form of a crash.

weaknesses.name: Assignment to Variable without Use
weaknesses.description: The variable's value is assigned but never used, making it a dead store.

weaknesses.name: SQL Injection: Hibernate
weaknesses.description: Using Hibernate to execute a dynamic SQL statement built with user-controlled input can allow an attacker to modify the statement's meaning or to execute arbitrary SQL commands.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking
weaknesses.description: The product relies on the existence or values of cookies when performing security-critical operations, but it does not properly ensure that the setting is valid for the associated user.

weaknesses.name: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled SQL Primary Key
weaknesses.description: The product uses a database table that includes records that should not be accessible to an actor, but it executes a SQL statement with a primary key that can be controlled by that actor.

weaknesses.name: Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly synchronize shared data, such as static variables across threads, which can lead to undefined behavior and unpredictable data changes.

weaknesses.name: finalize() Method Without super.finalize()
weaknesses.description: The product contains a finalize() method that does not call super.finalize().

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: 'fakedir/../realdir/filename'
weaknesses.description: The product contains protection mechanisms to restrict access to 'realdir/filename', but it constructs pathnames using external input in the form of 'fakedir/../realdir/filename' that are not handled by those mechanisms. This allows attackers to perform unauthorized actions against the targeted file.

weaknesses.name: Expression is Always False
weaknesses.description: The product contains an expression that will always evaluate to false.

weaknesses.name: Expression is Always True
weaknesses.description: The product contains an expression that will always evaluate to true.

weaknesses.name: Call to Thread run() instead of start()
weaknesses.description: The product calls a thread's run() method instead of calling start(), which causes the code to run in the thread of the caller instead of the callee.

weaknesses.name: Improper Following of Specification by Caller
weaknesses.description: The product does not follow or incorrectly follows the specifications as required by the implementation language, environment, framework, protocol, or platform.

weaknesses.name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Synchronization Primitives
weaknesses.description: The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using thread synchronization primitives.

weaknesses.name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of AWT Swing
weaknesses.description: The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using AWT/Swing.

weaknesses.name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Java I/O
weaknesses.description: The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using the java.io package.

weaknesses.name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Sockets
weaknesses.description: The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using sockets.

weaknesses.name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of Class Loader
weaknesses.description: The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using the class loader.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Bad Practices: Non-serializable Object Stored in Session
weaknesses.description: The product stores a non-serializable object as an HttpSession attribute, which can hurt reliability.

weaknesses.name: Path Equivalence: Windows 8.3 Filename
weaknesses.description: The product contains a protection mechanism that restricts access to a long filename on a Windows operating system, but it does not properly restrict access to the equivalent short "8.3" filename.

weaknesses.name: clone() Method Without super.clone()
weaknesses.description: The product contains a clone() method that does not call super.clone() to obtain the new object.

weaknesses.name: Object Model Violation: Just One of Equals and Hashcode Defined
weaknesses.description: The product does not maintain equal hashcodes for equal objects.

weaknesses.name: Array Declared Public, Final, and Static
weaknesses.description: The product declares an array public, final, and static, which is not sufficient to prevent the array's contents from being modified.

weaknesses.name: finalize() Method Declared Public
weaknesses.description: The product violates secure coding principles for mobile code by declaring a finalize() method public.

weaknesses.name: Return Inside Finally Block
weaknesses.description: The code has a return statement inside a finally block, which will cause any thrown exception in the try block to be discarded.

weaknesses.name: Empty Synchronized Block
weaknesses.description: The product contains an empty synchronized block.

weaknesses.name: Explicit Call to Finalize()
weaknesses.description: The product makes an explicit call to the finalize() method from outside the finalizer.

weaknesses.name: Assignment of a Fixed Address to a Pointer
weaknesses.description: The product sets a pointer to a specific address other than NULL or 0.

weaknesses.name: Attempt to Access Child of a Non-structure Pointer
weaknesses.description: Casting a non-structure type to a structure type and accessing a field can lead to memory access errors or data corruption.

weaknesses.name: Call to Non-ubiquitous API
weaknesses.description: The product uses an API function that does not exist on all versions of the target platform. This could cause portability problems or inconsistencies that allow denial of service or other consequences.

weaknesses.name: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
weaknesses.description: The product attempts to access a file based on the filename, but it does not properly prevent that filename from identifying a link or shortcut that resolves to an unintended resource.

weaknesses.name: Free of Memory not on the Heap
weaknesses.description: The product calls free() on a pointer to memory that was not allocated using associated heap allocation functions such as malloc(), calloc(), or realloc().

weaknesses.name: Sensitive Data Storage in Improperly Locked Memory
weaknesses.description: The product stores sensitive data in memory that is not locked, or that has been incorrectly locked, which might cause the memory to be written to swap files on disk by the virtual memory manager. This can make the data more accessible to external actors.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Authentication Bypass Issues
weaknesses.description: This weakness has been deprecated because it covered redundant concepts already described in CWE-287.

weaknesses.name: Authentication Bypass: OpenSSL CTX Object Modified after SSL Objects are Created
weaknesses.description: The product modifies the SSL context after connection creation has begun.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Framework: Saving Unserializable Objects to Disk
weaknesses.description: When the J2EE container attempts to write unserializable objects to disk there is no guarantee that the process will complete successfully.

weaknesses.name: Comparison of Object References Instead of Object Contents
weaknesses.description: The product compares object references instead of the contents of the objects themselves, preventing it from detecting equivalent objects.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Incorrect Semantic Object Comparison
weaknesses.description: This weakness has been deprecated. It was poorly described and difficult to distinguish from other entries. It was also inappropriate to assign a separate ID solely because of domain-specific considerations. Its closest equivalent is CWE-1023.

weaknesses.name: Use of Wrong Operator in String Comparison
weaknesses.description: The product uses the wrong operator when comparing a string, such as using "==" when the .equals() method should be used instead.

weaknesses.name: Use of GET Request Method With Sensitive Query Strings
weaknesses.description: The web application uses the HTTP GET method to process a request and includes sensitive information in the query string of that request.

weaknesses.name: Missing Validation of OpenSSL Certificate
weaknesses.description: The product uses OpenSSL and trusts or uses a certificate without using the SSL_get_verify_result() function to ensure that the certificate satisfies all necessary security requirements.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Insufficient Session-ID Length
weaknesses.description: The J2EE application is configured to use an insufficient session ID length.

weaknesses.name: Uncaught Exception in Servlet
weaknesses.description: The Servlet does not catch all exceptions, which may reveal sensitive debugging information.

weaknesses.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
weaknesses.description: The web application accepts a user-controlled input that specifies a link to an external site, and uses that link in a redirect.

weaknesses.name: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
weaknesses.description: The product is composed of a server that relies on the client to implement a mechanism that is intended to protect the server.

weaknesses.name: Use of Client-Side Authentication
weaknesses.description: A client/server product performs authentication within client code but not in server code, allowing server-side authentication to be bypassed via a modified client that omits the authentication check.

weaknesses.name: Multiple Binds to the Same Port
weaknesses.description: When multiple sockets are allowed to bind to the same port, other services on that port may be stolen or spoofed.

weaknesses.name: Unchecked Input for Loop Condition
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly check inputs that are used for loop conditions, potentially leading to a denial of service or other consequences because of excessive looping.

weaknesses.name: Public Static Final Field References Mutable Object
weaknesses.description: A public or protected static final field references a mutable object, which allows the object to be changed by malicious code, or accidentally from another package.

weaknesses.name: Struts: Non-private Field in ActionForm Class
weaknesses.description: An ActionForm class contains a field that has not been declared private, which can be accessed without using a setter or getter.

weaknesses.name: Double-Checked Locking
weaknesses.description: The product uses double-checked locking to access a resource without the overhead of explicit synchronization, but the locking is insufficient.

weaknesses.name: UNIX Symbolic Link (Symlink) Following
weaknesses.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently account for when the file is a symbolic link that resolves to a target outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

weaknesses.name: Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere
weaknesses.description: The product uses an externally controlled name or reference that resolves to a resource that is outside of the intended control sphere.

weaknesses.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference
weaknesses.description: The product processes an XML document that can contain XML entities with URIs that resolve to documents outside of the intended sphere of control, causing the product to embed incorrect documents into its output.

weaknesses.name: Improper Authorization of Index Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: The product creates a search index of private or sensitive documents, but it does not properly limit index access to actors who are authorized to see the original information.

weaknesses.name: Insufficient Session Expiration
weaknesses.description: According to WASC, "Insufficient Session Expiration is when a web site permits an attacker to reuse old session credentials or session IDs for authorization."

weaknesses.name: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute
weaknesses.description: The Secure attribute for sensitive cookies in HTTPS sessions is not set, which could cause the user agent to send those cookies in plaintext over an HTTP session.

weaknesses.name: Inclusion of Sensitive Information in Source Code Comments
weaknesses.description: While adding general comments is very useful, some programmers tend to leave important data, such as: filenames related to the web application, old links or links which were not meant to be browsed by users, old code fragments, etc.

weaknesses.name: Incomplete Identification of Uploaded File Variables (PHP)
weaknesses.description: The PHP application uses an old method for processing uploaded files by referencing the four global variables that are set for each file (e.g. $varname, $varname_size, $varname_name, $varname_type). These variables could be overwritten by attackers, causing the application to process unauthorized files.

weaknesses.name: Reachable Assertion
weaknesses.description: The product contains an assert() or similar statement that can be triggered by an attacker, which leads to an application exit or other behavior that is more severe than necessary.

weaknesses.name: Exposed Unsafe ActiveX Method
weaknesses.description: An ActiveX control is intended for use in a web browser, but it exposes dangerous methods that perform actions that are outside of the browser's security model (e.g. the zone or domain).

weaknesses.name: Dangling Database Cursor ('Cursor Injection')
weaknesses.description: If a database cursor is not closed properly, then it could become accessible to other users while retaining the same privileges that were originally assigned, leaving the cursor "dangling."

weaknesses.name: UNIX Hard Link
weaknesses.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently account for when the name is associated with a hard link to a target that is outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

weaknesses.name: Unverified Password Change
weaknesses.description: When setting a new password for a user, the product does not require knowledge of the original password, or using another form of authentication.

weaknesses.name: Variable Extraction Error
weaknesses.description: The product uses external input to determine the names of variables into which information is extracted, without verifying that the names of the specified variables are valid. This could cause the program to overwrite unintended variables.

weaknesses.name: Improper Validation of Function Hook Arguments
weaknesses.description: The product adds hooks to user-accessible API functions, but it does not properly validate the arguments. This could lead to resultant vulnerabilities.

weaknesses.name: Unsafe ActiveX Control Marked Safe For Scripting
weaknesses.description: An ActiveX control is intended for restricted use, but it has been marked as safe-for-scripting.

weaknesses.name: Executable Regular Expression Error
weaknesses.description: The product uses a regular expression that either (1) contains an executable component with user-controlled inputs, or (2) allows a user to enable execution by inserting pattern modifiers.

weaknesses.name: Permissive Regular Expression
weaknesses.description: The product uses a regular expression that does not sufficiently restrict the set of allowed values.

weaknesses.name: Null Byte Interaction Error (Poison Null Byte)
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly handle null bytes or NUL characters when passing data between different representations or components.

weaknesses.name: Dynamic Variable Evaluation
weaknesses.description: In a language where the user can influence the name of a variable at runtime, if the variable names are not controlled, an attacker can read or write to arbitrary variables, or access arbitrary functions.

weaknesses.name: Function Call with Incorrectly Specified Arguments
weaknesses.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine with arguments that are not correctly specified, leading to always-incorrect behavior and resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Not Failing Securely ('Failing Open')
weaknesses.description: When the product encounters an error condition or failure, its design requires it to fall back to a state that is less secure than other options that are available, such as selecting the weakest encryption algorithm or using the most permissive access control restrictions.

weaknesses.name: Unnecessary Complexity in Protection Mechanism (Not Using 'Economy of Mechanism')
weaknesses.description: The product uses a more complex mechanism than necessary, which could lead to resultant weaknesses when the mechanism is not correctly understood, modeled, configured, implemented, or used.

weaknesses.name: Not Using Complete Mediation
weaknesses.description: The product does not perform access checks on a resource every time the resource is accessed by an entity, which can create resultant weaknesses if that entity's rights or privileges change over time.

weaknesses.name: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
weaknesses.description: The system's authorization functionality does not prevent one user from gaining access to another user's data or record by modifying the key value identifying the data.

weaknesses.name: Windows Shortcut Following (.LNK)
weaknesses.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently handle when the file is a Windows shortcut (.LNK) whose target is outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

weaknesses.name: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password
weaknesses.description: The product contains a mechanism for users to recover or change their passwords without knowing the original password, but the mechanism is weak.

weaknesses.name: Improper Restriction of Names for Files and Other Resources
weaknesses.description: The product constructs the name of a file or other resource using input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the resulting name.

weaknesses.name: External Control of Critical State Data
weaknesses.description: The product stores security-critical state information about its users, or the product itself, in a location that is accessible to unauthorized actors.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Data within XPath Expressions ('XPath Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product uses external input to dynamically construct an XPath expression used to retrieve data from an XML database, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes that input. This allows an attacker to control the structure of the query.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax
weaknesses.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes web scripting syntax in HTTP headers that can be used by web browser components that can process raw headers, such as Flash.

weaknesses.name: Overly Restrictive Account Lockout Mechanism
weaknesses.description: The product contains an account lockout protection mechanism, but the mechanism is too restrictive and can be triggered too easily, which allows attackers to deny service to legitimate users by causing their accounts to be locked out.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on File Name or Extension of Externally-Supplied File
weaknesses.description: The product allows a file to be uploaded, but it relies on the file name or extension of the file to determine the appropriate behaviors. This could be used by attackers to cause the file to be misclassified and processed in a dangerous fashion.

weaknesses.name: Use of Non-Canonical URL Paths for Authorization Decisions
weaknesses.description: The product defines policy namespaces and makes authorization decisions based on the assumption that a URL is canonical. This can allow a non-canonical URL to bypass the authorization.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Use of Privileged APIs
weaknesses.description: The product does not conform to the API requirements for a function call that requires extra privileges. This could allow attackers to gain privileges by causing the function to be called incorrectly.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on Obfuscation or Encryption of Security-Relevant Inputs without Integrity Checking
weaknesses.description: The product uses obfuscation or encryption of inputs that should not be mutable by an external actor, but the product does not use integrity checks to detect if those inputs have been modified.

weaknesses.name: Windows Hard Link
weaknesses.description: The product, when opening a file or directory, does not sufficiently handle when the name is associated with a hard link to a target that is outside of the intended control sphere. This could allow an attacker to cause the product to operate on unauthorized files.

weaknesses.name: Trusting HTTP Permission Methods on the Server Side
weaknesses.description: The server contains a protection mechanism that assumes that any URI that is accessed using HTTP GET will not cause a state change to the associated resource. This might allow attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and conduct resource modification and deletion attacks, since some applications allow GET to modify state.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of WSDL File Containing Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: The Web services architecture may require exposing a Web Service Definition Language (WSDL) file that contains information on the publicly accessible services and how callers of these services should interact with them (e.g. what parameters they expect and what types they return).

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Data within XQuery Expressions ('XQuery Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product uses external input to dynamically construct an XQuery expression used to retrieve data from an XML database, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes that input. This allows an attacker to control the structure of the query.

weaknesses.name: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly compartmentalize or isolate functionality, processes, or resources that require different privilege levels, rights, or permissions.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on a Single Factor in a Security Decision
weaknesses.description: A protection mechanism relies exclusively, or to a large extent, on the evaluation of a single condition or the integrity of a single object or entity in order to make a decision about granting access to restricted resources or functionality.

weaknesses.name: Insufficient Psychological Acceptability
weaknesses.description: The product has a protection mechanism that is too difficult or inconvenient to use, encouraging non-malicious users to disable or bypass the mechanism, whether by accident or on purpose.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on Security Through Obscurity
weaknesses.description: The product uses a protection mechanism whose strength depends heavily on its obscurity, such that knowledge of its algorithms or key data is sufficient to defeat the mechanism.

weaknesses.name: Violation of Secure Design Principles
weaknesses.description: The product violates well-established principles for secure design.

weaknesses.name: Improper Handling of File Names that Identify Virtual Resources
weaknesses.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles a file name that identifies a "virtual" resource that is not directly specified within the directory that is associated with the file name, causing the product to perform file-based operations on a resource that is not a file.

weaknesses.name: Improper Synchronization
weaknesses.description: The product utilizes multiple threads or processes to allow temporary access to a shared resource that can only be exclusive to one process at a time, but it does not properly synchronize these actions, which might cause simultaneous accesses of this resource by multiple threads or processes.

weaknesses.name: Use of a Non-reentrant Function in a Concurrent Context
weaknesses.description: The product calls a non-reentrant function in a concurrent context in which a competing code sequence (e.g. thread or signal handler) may have an opportunity to call the same function or otherwise influence its state.

weaknesses.name: Improper Control of a Resource Through its Lifetime
weaknesses.description: The product does not maintain or incorrectly maintains control over a resource throughout its lifetime of creation, use, and release.

weaknesses.name: Improper Initialization
weaknesses.description: The product does not initialize or incorrectly initializes a resource, which might leave the resource in an unexpected state when it is accessed or used.

weaknesses.name: Operation on Resource in Wrong Phase of Lifetime
weaknesses.description: The product performs an operation on a resource at the wrong phase of the resource's lifecycle, which can lead to unexpected behaviors.

weaknesses.name: Improper Locking
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly acquire or release a lock on a resource, leading to unexpected resource state changes and behaviors.

weaknesses.name: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
weaknesses.description: The product exposes a resource to the wrong control sphere, providing unintended actors with inappropriate access to the resource.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Resource Transfer Between Spheres
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly transfer a resource/behavior to another sphere, or improperly imports a resource/behavior from another sphere, in a manner that provides unintended control over that resource.

weaknesses.name: Improper Handling of Windows Device Names
weaknesses.description: The product constructs pathnames from user input, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles a pathname containing a Windows device name such as AUX or CON. This typically leads to denial of service or an information exposure when the application attempts to process the pathname as a regular file.

weaknesses.name: Always-Incorrect Control Flow Implementation
weaknesses.description: The code contains a control flow path that does not reflect the algorithm that the path is intended to implement, leading to incorrect behavior any time this path is navigated.

weaknesses.name: Lack of Administrator Control over Security
weaknesses.description: The product uses security features in a way that prevents the product's administrator from tailoring security settings to reflect the environment in which the product is being used. This introduces resultant weaknesses or prevents it from operating at a level of security that is desired by the administrator.

weaknesses.name: Operation on a Resource after Expiration or Release
weaknesses.description: The product uses, accesses, or otherwise operates on a resource after that resource has been expired, released, or revoked.

weaknesses.name: External Influence of Sphere Definition
weaknesses.description: The product does not prevent the definition of control spheres from external actors.

weaknesses.name: Uncontrolled Recursion
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly control the amount of recursion that takes place, consuming excessive resources, such as allocated memory or the program stack.

weaknesses.name: Multiple Operations on Resource in Single-Operation Context
weaknesses.description: The product performs the same operation on a resource two or more times, when the operation should only be applied once.

weaknesses.name: Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
weaknesses.description: The product invokes a potentially dangerous function that could introduce a vulnerability if it is used incorrectly, but the function can also be used safely.

weaknesses.name: Integer Overflow to Buffer Overflow
weaknesses.description: The product performs a calculation to determine how much memory to allocate, but an integer overflow can occur that causes less memory to be allocated than expected, leading to a buffer overflow.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Conversion between Numeric Types
weaknesses.description: When converting from one data type to another, such as long to integer, data can be omitted or translated in a way that produces unexpected values. If the resulting values are used in a sensitive context, then dangerous behaviors may occur.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Calculation
weaknesses.description: The product performs a calculation that generates incorrect or unintended results that are later used in security-critical decisions or resource management.

weaknesses.name: Function Call With Incorrect Order of Arguments
weaknesses.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies the arguments in an incorrect order, leading to resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Provision of Specified Functionality
weaknesses.description: The code does not function according to its published specifications, potentially leading to incorrect usage.

weaknesses.name: Function Call With Incorrect Number of Arguments
weaknesses.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies too many arguments, or too few arguments, which may lead to undefined behavior and resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Function Call With Incorrect Argument Type
weaknesses.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies an argument that is the wrong data type, which may lead to resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Function Call With Incorrectly Specified Argument Value
weaknesses.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies an argument that contains the wrong value, which may lead to resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Function Call With Incorrect Variable or Reference as Argument
weaknesses.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine, but the caller specifies the wrong variable or reference as one of the arguments, which may lead to undefined behavior and resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Permission Race Condition During Resource Copy
weaknesses.description: The product, while copying or cloning a resource, does not set the resource's permissions or access control until the copy is complete, leaving the resource exposed to other spheres while the copy is taking place.

weaknesses.name: Improper Handling of Windows ::DATA Alternate Data Stream
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly prevent access to, or detect usage of, alternate data streams (ADS).

weaknesses.name: Unchecked Return Value to NULL Pointer Dereference
weaknesses.description: The product does not check for an error after calling a function that can return with a NULL pointer if the function fails, which leads to a resultant NULL pointer dereference.

weaknesses.name: Insufficient Control Flow Management
weaknesses.description: The code does not sufficiently manage its control flow during execution, creating conditions in which the control flow can be modified in unexpected ways.

weaknesses.name: Incomplete Denylist to Cross-Site Scripting
weaknesses.description: The product uses a denylist-based protection mechanism to defend against XSS attacks, but the denylist is incomplete, allowing XSS variants to succeed.

weaknesses.name: Protection Mechanism Failure
weaknesses.description: The product does not use or incorrectly uses a protection mechanism that provides sufficient defense against directed attacks against the product.

weaknesses.name: Use of Multiple Resources with Duplicate Identifier
weaknesses.description: The product uses multiple resources that can have the same identifier, in a context in which unique identifiers are required.

weaknesses.name: Use of Low-Level Functionality
weaknesses.description: The product uses low-level functionality that is explicitly prohibited by the framework or specification under which the product is supposed to operate.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Behavior Order
weaknesses.description: The product performs multiple related behaviors, but the behaviors are performed in the wrong order in ways which may produce resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Comparison
weaknesses.description: The product compares two entities in a security-relevant context, but the comparison is incorrect, which may lead to resultant weaknesses.

weaknesses.name: Execution After Redirect (EAR)
weaknesses.description: The web application sends a redirect to another location, but instead of exiting, it executes additional code.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Missing Custom Error Page
weaknesses.description: The default error page of a web application should not display sensitive information about the product.

weaknesses.name: Improper Check or Handling of Exceptional Conditions
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly anticipate or handle exceptional conditions that rarely occur during normal operation of the product.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast
weaknesses.description: The product does not correctly convert an object, resource, or structure from one type to a different type.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Control Flow Scoping
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly return control flow to the proper location after it has completed a task or detected an unusual condition.

weaknesses.name: Use of Incorrectly-Resolved Name or Reference
weaknesses.description: The product uses a name or reference to access a resource, but the name/reference resolves to a resource that is outside of the intended control sphere.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization
weaknesses.description: The product does not ensure or incorrectly ensures that structured messages or data are well-formed and that certain security properties are met before being read from an upstream component or sent to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Ownership Assignment
weaknesses.description: The product assigns an owner to a resource, but the owner is outside of the intended control sphere.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Apple '.DS_Store'
weaknesses.description: This entry has been deprecated as it represents a specific observed example of a UNIX Hard Link weakness type rather than its own individual weakness type. Please refer to CWE-62.

weaknesses.name: Improper Adherence to Coding Standards
weaknesses.description: The product does not follow certain coding rules for development, which can lead to resultant weaknesses or increase the severity of the associated vulnerabilities.

weaknesses.name: Improper Handling of Apple HFS+ Alternate Data Stream Path
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly handle special paths that may identify the data or resource fork of a file on the HFS+ file system.

weaknesses.name: External Control of File Name or Path
weaknesses.description: The product allows user input to control or influence paths or file names that are used in filesystem operations.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
weaknesses.description: The product specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors.

weaknesses.name: Compiler Optimization Removal or Modification of Security-critical Code
weaknesses.description: The developer builds a security-critical protection mechanism into the software, but the compiler optimizes the program such that the mechanism is removed or modified.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs all or part of a command, data structure, or record using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify how it is parsed or interpreted when it is sent to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function
weaknesses.description: The product provides an Applications Programming Interface (API) or similar interface for interaction with external actors, but the interface includes a dangerous method or function that is not properly restricted.

weaknesses.name: Failure to Sanitize Special Elements into a Different Plane (Special Element Injection)
weaknesses.description: The product does not adequately filter user-controlled input for special elements with control implications.

weaknesses.name: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions
weaknesses.description: The product does not check or incorrectly checks for unusual or exceptional conditions that are not expected to occur frequently during day to day operation of the product.

weaknesses.name: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
weaknesses.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles an exceptional condition.

weaknesses.name: Missing Custom Error Page
weaknesses.description: The product does not return custom error pages to the user, possibly exposing sensitive information.

weaknesses.name: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation ('Algorithm Downgrade')
weaknesses.description: A protocol or its implementation supports interaction between multiple actors and allows those actors to negotiate which algorithm should be used as a protection mechanism such as encryption or authentication, but it does not select the strongest algorithm that is available to both parties.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on Undefined, Unspecified, or Implementation-Defined Behavior
weaknesses.description: The product uses an API function, data structure, or other entity in a way that relies on properties that are not always guaranteed to hold for that entity.

weaknesses.name: Use of a One-Way Hash without a Salt
weaknesses.description: The product uses a one-way cryptographic hash against an input that should not be reversible, such as a password, but the product does not also use a salt as part of the input.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Equivalent Special Elements
weaknesses.description: The product correctly neutralizes certain special elements, but it improperly neutralizes equivalent special elements.

weaknesses.name: Use of a One-Way Hash with a Predictable Salt
weaknesses.description: The product uses a one-way cryptographic hash against an input that should not be reversible, such as a password, but the product uses a predictable salt as part of the input.

weaknesses.name: Free of Pointer not at Start of Buffer
weaknesses.description: The product calls free() on a pointer to a memory resource that was allocated on the heap, but the pointer is not at the start of the buffer.

weaknesses.name: Mismatched Memory Management Routines
weaknesses.description: The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls a release function that is not compatible with the function that was originally used to allocate that resource.

weaknesses.name: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference
weaknesses.description: The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls the wrong release function or calls the appropriate release function incorrectly.

weaknesses.name: Multiple Locks of a Critical Resource
weaknesses.description: The product locks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.

weaknesses.name: Multiple Unlocks of a Critical Resource
weaknesses.description: The product unlocks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.

weaknesses.name: Critical Data Element Declared Public
weaknesses.description: The product declares a critical variable, field, or member to be public when intended security policy requires it to be private.

weaknesses.name: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method
weaknesses.description: The product defines a public method that reads or modifies a private variable.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Short Circuit Evaluation
weaknesses.description: The product contains a conditional statement with multiple logical expressions in which one of the non-leading expressions may produce side effects. This may lead to an unexpected state in the program after the execution of the conditional, because short-circuiting logic may prevent the side effects from occurring.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Uncontrolled File Descriptor Consumption
weaknesses.description: This entry has been deprecated because it was a duplicate of CWE-774. All content has been transferred to CWE-774.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
weaknesses.description: The product allocates a reusable resource or group of resources on behalf of an actor without imposing any restrictions on the size or number of resources that can be allocated, in violation of the intended security policy for that actor.

weaknesses.name: Missing Reference to Active Allocated Resource
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly maintain a reference to a resource that has been allocated, which prevents the resource from being reclaimed.

weaknesses.name: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
weaknesses.description: The product does not release a resource after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the resource is no longer needed.

weaknesses.name: Missing Reference to Active File Descriptor or Handle
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly maintain references to a file descriptor or handle, which prevents that file descriptor/handle from being reclaimed.

weaknesses.name: Allocation of File Descriptors or Handles Without Limits or Throttling
weaknesses.description: The product allocates file descriptors or handles on behalf of an actor without imposing any restrictions on how many descriptors can be allocated, in violation of the intended security policy for that actor.

weaknesses.name: Missing Release of File Descriptor or Handle after Effective Lifetime
weaknesses.description: The product does not release a file descriptor or handle after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the file descriptor/handle is no longer needed.

weaknesses.name: Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion')
weaknesses.description: The product uses XML documents and allows their structure to be defined with a Document Type Definition (DTD), but it does not properly control the number of recursive definitions of entities.

weaknesses.name: Regular Expression without Anchors
weaknesses.description: The product uses a regular expression to perform neutralization, but the regular expression is not anchored and may allow malicious or malformed data to slip through.

weaknesses.name: Insufficient Logging
weaknesses.description: When a security-critical event occurs, the product either does not record the event or omits important details about the event when logging it.

weaknesses.name: Logging of Excessive Data
weaknesses.description: The product logs too much information, making log files hard to process and possibly hindering recovery efforts or forensic analysis after an attack.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Use of RSA Algorithm without OAEP
weaknesses.description: The product uses the RSA algorithm but does not incorporate Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP), which might weaken the encryption.

weaknesses.name: Improper Address Validation in IOCTL with METHOD_NEITHER I/O Control Code
weaknesses.description: The product defines an IOCTL that uses METHOD_NEITHER for I/O, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates the addresses that are provided.

weaknesses.name: Exposed IOCTL with Insufficient Access Control
weaknesses.description: The product implements an IOCTL with functionality that should be restricted, but it does not properly enforce access control for the IOCTL.

weaknesses.name: Operator Precedence Logic Error
weaknesses.description: The product uses an expression in which operator precedence causes incorrect logic to be used.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking in a Security Decision
weaknesses.description: The product uses a protection mechanism that relies on the existence or values of a cookie, but it does not properly ensure that the cookie is valid for the associated user.

weaknesses.name: Use of Path Manipulation Function without Maximum-sized Buffer
weaknesses.description: The product invokes a function for normalizing paths or file names, but it provides an output buffer that is smaller than the maximum possible size, such as PATH_MAX.

weaknesses.name: Access of Memory Location Before Start of Buffer
weaknesses.description: The product reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location prior to the beginning of the buffer.

weaknesses.name: Out-of-bounds Write
weaknesses.description: The product writes data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

weaknesses.name: Access of Memory Location After End of Buffer
weaknesses.description: The product reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location after the end of the buffer.

weaknesses.name: Memory Allocation with Excessive Size Value
weaknesses.description: The product allocates memory based on an untrusted, large size value, but it does not ensure that the size is within expected limits, allowing arbitrary amounts of memory to be allocated.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
weaknesses.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page that is served to other users.

weaknesses.name: Improper Filtering of Special Elements
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not filter or incorrectly filters special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Incomplete Filtering of Special Elements
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not completely filter special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Incomplete Filtering of One or More Instances of Special Elements
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not completely filter one or more instances of special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Only Filtering One Instance of a Special Element
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only filters a single instance of a special element before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Incomplete Filtering of Multiple Instances of Special Elements
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not filter all instances of a special element before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Only Filtering Special Elements at a Specified Location
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only accounts for special elements at a specified location, thereby missing remaining special elements that may exist before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Only Filtering Special Elements Relative to a Marker
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only accounts for special elements positioned relative to a marker (e.g. "at the beginning/end of a string; the second argument"), thereby missing remaining special elements that may exist before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Only Filtering Special Elements at an Absolute Position
weaknesses.description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but only accounts for special elements at an absolute position (e.g. "byte number 10"), thereby missing remaining special elements that may exist before sending it to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
weaknesses.description: The product contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key.

weaknesses.name: Improper Control of Interaction Frequency
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly limit the number or frequency of interactions that it has with an actor, such as the number of incoming requests.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Entity Bean Declared Remote
weaknesses.description: When an application exposes a remote interface for an entity bean, it might also expose methods that get or set the bean's data. These methods could be leveraged to read sensitive information, or to change data in ways that violate the application's expectations, potentially leading to other vulnerabilities.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)
weaknesses.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special characters such as "<", ">", and "&" that could be interpreted as web-scripting elements when they are sent to a downstream component that processes web pages.

weaknesses.name: Guessable CAPTCHA
weaknesses.description: The product uses a CAPTCHA challenge, but the challenge can be guessed or automatically recognized by a non-human actor.

weaknesses.name: Buffer Access with Incorrect Length Value
weaknesses.description: The product uses a sequential operation to read or write a buffer, but it uses an incorrect length value that causes it to access memory that is outside of the bounds of the buffer.

weaknesses.name: Buffer Access Using Size of Source Buffer
weaknesses.description: The product uses the size of a source buffer when reading from or writing to a destination buffer, which may cause it to access memory that is outside of the bounds of the buffer.

weaknesses.name: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
weaknesses.description: The product uses a protection mechanism that relies on the existence or values of an input, but the input can be modified by an untrusted actor in a way that bypasses the protection mechanism.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Script in an Error Message Web Page
weaknesses.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special characters that could be interpreted as web-scripting elements when they are sent to an error page.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Script in Attributes of IMG Tags in a Web Page
weaknesses.description: The web application does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes scripting elements within attributes of HTML IMG tags, such as the src attribute.

weaknesses.name: Missing Synchronization
weaknesses.description: The product utilizes a shared resource in a concurrent manner but does not attempt to synchronize access to the resource.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Synchronization
weaknesses.description: The product utilizes a shared resource in a concurrent manner, but it does not correctly synchronize access to the resource.

weaknesses.name: Untrusted Pointer Dereference
weaknesses.description: The product obtains a value from an untrusted source, converts this value to a pointer, and dereferences the resulting pointer.

weaknesses.name: Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset
weaknesses.description: The product performs pointer arithmetic on a valid pointer, but it uses an offset that can point outside of the intended range of valid memory locations for the resulting pointer.

weaknesses.name: Access of Uninitialized Pointer
weaknesses.description: The product accesses or uses a pointer that has not been initialized.

weaknesses.name: Expired Pointer Dereference
weaknesses.description: The product dereferences a pointer that contains a location for memory that was previously valid, but is no longer valid.

weaknesses.name: Premature Release of Resource During Expected Lifetime
weaknesses.description: The product releases a resource that is still intended to be used by itself or another actor.

weaknesses.name: Improper Control of Document Type Definition
weaknesses.description: The product does not restrict a reference to a Document Type Definition (DTD) to the intended control sphere. This might allow attackers to reference arbitrary DTDs, possibly causing the product to expose files, consume excessive system resources, or execute arbitrary http requests on behalf of the attacker.

weaknesses.name: Signal Handler with Functionality that is not Asynchronous-Safe
weaknesses.description: The product defines a signal handler that contains code sequences that are not asynchronous-safe, i.e., the functionality is not reentrant, or it can be interrupted.

weaknesses.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
weaknesses.description: The product imports, requires, or includes executable functionality (such as a library) from a source that is outside of the intended control sphere.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Script in Attributes in a Web Page
weaknesses.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes "javascript:" or other URIs from dangerous attributes within tags, such as onmouseover, onload, onerror, or style.

weaknesses.name: Inclusion of Web Functionality from an Untrusted Source
weaknesses.description: The product includes web functionality (such as a web widget) from another domain, which causes it to operate within the domain of the product, potentially granting total access and control of the product to the untrusted source.

weaknesses.name: Signal Handler Function Associated with Multiple Signals
weaknesses.description: The product defines a function that is used as a handler for more than one signal.

weaknesses.name: Unlock of a Resource that is not Locked
weaknesses.description: The product attempts to unlock a resource that is not locked.

weaknesses.name: Deadlock
weaknesses.description: The product contains multiple threads or executable segments that are waiting for each other to release a necessary lock, resulting in deadlock.

weaknesses.name: Excessive Iteration
weaknesses.description: The product performs an iteration or loop without sufficiently limiting the number of times that the loop is executed.

weaknesses.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
weaknesses.description: The product contains an iteration or loop with an exit condition that cannot be reached, i.e., an infinite loop.

weaknesses.name: Use of Password Hash Instead of Password for Authentication
weaknesses.description: The product records password hashes in a data store, receives a hash of a password from a client, and compares the supplied hash to the hash obtained from the data store.

weaknesses.name: Improper Enforcement of a Single, Unique Action
weaknesses.description: The product requires that an actor should only be able to perform an action once, or to have only one unique action, but the product does not enforce or improperly enforces this restriction.

weaknesses.name: Inappropriate Encoding for Output Context
weaknesses.description: The product uses or specifies an encoding when generating output to a downstream component, but the specified encoding is not the same as the encoding that is expected by the downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check
weaknesses.description: The product checks a value to ensure that it is less than or equal to a maximum, but it does not also verify that the value is greater than or equal to the minimum.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Encoded URI Schemes in a Web Page
weaknesses.description: The web application improperly neutralizes user-controlled input for executable script disguised with URI encodings.

weaknesses.name: Improper Enforcement of Behavioral Workflow
weaknesses.description: The product supports a session in which more than one behavior must be performed by an actor, but it does not properly ensure that the actor performs the behaviors in the required sequence.

weaknesses.name: Placement of User into Incorrect Group
weaknesses.description: The product or the administrator places a user into an incorrect group.

weaknesses.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')
weaknesses.description: The product allocates or initializes a resource such as a pointer, object, or variable using one type, but it later accesses that resource using a type that is incompatible with the original type.

weaknesses.name: Doubled Character XSS Manipulations
weaknesses.description: The web application does not filter user-controlled input for executable script disguised using doubling of the involved characters.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Invalid Characters in Identifiers in Web Pages
weaknesses.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes invalid characters or byte sequences in the middle of tag names, URI schemes, and other identifiers.

weaknesses.name: Missing Authorization
weaknesses.description: The product does not perform an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

weaknesses.name: Incorrect Authorization
weaknesses.description: The product performs an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action, but it does not correctly perform the check.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Alternate XSS Syntax
weaknesses.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controlled input for alternate script syntax.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs a string for a command to be executed by a separate component in another control sphere, but it does not properly delimit the intended arguments, options, or switches within that command string.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended SQL command when it is sent to a downstream component. Without sufficient removal or quoting of SQL syntax in user-controllable inputs, the generated SQL query can cause those inputs to be interpreted as SQL instead of ordinary user data.

weaknesses.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Weak Access Permissions for EJB Methods
weaknesses.description: If elevated access rights are assigned to EJB methods, then an attacker can take advantage of the permissions to exploit the product.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an LDAP Query ('LDAP Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs all or part of an LDAP query using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended LDAP query when it is sent to a downstream component.

weaknesses.name: Use of Uninitialized Resource
weaknesses.description: The product uses or accesses a resource that has not been initialized.

weaknesses.name: Missing Initialization of Resource
weaknesses.description: The product does not initialize a critical resource.

weaknesses.name: XML Injection (aka Blind XPath Injection)
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly neutralize special elements that are used in XML, allowing attackers to modify the syntax, content, or commands of the XML before it is processed by an end system.

weaknesses.name: Use of Expired File Descriptor
weaknesses.description: The product uses or accesses a file descriptor after it has been closed.

weaknesses.name: Improper Update of Reference Count
weaknesses.description: The product uses a reference count to manage a resource, but it does not update or incorrectly updates the reference count.

weaknesses.name: Hidden Functionality
weaknesses.description: The product contains functionality that is not documented, not part of the specification, and not accessible through an interface or command sequence that is obvious to the product's users or administrators.

weaknesses.name: Improper Control of Dynamically-Managed Code Resources
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-managed code resources such as variables, objects, classes, attributes, functions, or executable instructions or statements.

weaknesses.name: Improper Control of Dynamically-Identified Variables
weaknesses.description: The product does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-identified variables.

weaknesses.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Dynamically-Determined Object Attributes
weaknesses.description: The product receives input from an upstream component that specifies multiple attributes, properties, or fields that are to be initialized or updated in an object, but it does not properly control which attributes can be modified.

weaknesses.name: Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort
weaknesses.description: The product generates a hash for a password, but it uses a scheme that does not provide a sufficient level of computational effort that would make password cracking attacks infeasible or expensive.

weaknesses.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an Expression Language Statement ('Expression Language Injection')
weaknesses.description: The product constructs all or part of an expression language (EL) statement in a framework such as a Java Server Page (JSP) using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended EL statement before it is executed.

weaknesses.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
weaknesses.description: The web server receives a URL or similar request from an upstream component and retrieves the contents of this URL, but it does not sufficiently ensure that the request is being sent to the expected destination.

weaknesses.name: DEPRECATED: Improper Sanitization of Custom Special Characters
weaknesses.description: This entry has been deprecated. It originally came from PLOVER, which sometimes defined "other" and "miscellaneous" categories in order to satisfy exhaustiveness requirements for taxonomies. Within the context of CWE, the use of a more abstract entry is preferred in mapping situations. CWE-75 is a more appropriate mapping.

weaknesses.name: Improper Restriction of Power Consumption
weaknesses.description: The product operates in an environment in which power is a limited resource that cannot be automatically replenished, but the product does not properly restrict the amount of power that its operation consumes.

weaknesses.name: Storage of Sensitive Data in a Mechanism without Access Control
weaknesses.description: The product stores sensitive information in a file system or device that does not have built-in access control.

weaknesses.name: Insecure Storage of Sensitive Information
weaknesses.description: The product stores sensitive information without properly limiting read or write access by unauthorized actors.

weaknesses.name: Improper Restriction of Communication Channel to Intended Endpoints
weaknesses.description: The product establishes a communication channel to (or from) an endpoint for privileged or protected operations, but it does not properly ensure that it is communicating with the correct endpoint.

weaknesses.name: Improper Enforcement of Message Integrity During Transmission in a Communication Channel
weaknesses.description: The product establishes a communication channel with an endpoint and receives a message from that endpoint, but it does not sufficiently ensure that the message was not modified during transmission.

weaknesses.name: Improper Verification of Intent by Broadcast Receiver
weaknesses.description: The Android application uses a Broadcast Receiver that receives an Intent but does not properly verify that the Intent came from an authorized source.

weaknesses.name: Improper Export of Android Application Components
weaknesses.description: The Android application exports a component for use by other applications, but does not properly restrict which applications can launch the component or access the data it contains.
